wikipedia.summary: The snowy owl is a large, white owl of the true owl family. Males are almost all white, while females have more flecks of black plumage. It is a nomadic bird, rarely breeding at the same locations or with the same mates on an annual basis.

The bald eagle is a bird of prey found in North America. As both the national bird and national animal of the United States, the bald eagle appears on its seal. Adults have a dark-brown plumage with a white head and tail.

The peregrine falcon is a widespread bird of prey in the family Falconidae. It is renowned for its speed, reaching over 320 km/h during its hunting stoop, making it the fastest bird in the world. The peregrine's breeding range includes land regions from the Arctic tundra to the tropics.
